headline.print_headline: Report Finds Explosive Growth in Number of Women Held in Local Jails
headline.main: Number of Women in Jail Has Grown Far Faster Than That of Men, Study Says

snippet: It found that the total of those held for misdemeanor crimes or who are awaiting trial or sentencing had increased to about 110,000 in 2014 from fewer than 8,000 in 1970....
abstract: Joint study by Vera Institute of Justice and Safety and Justice Challenge program finds that 110,000 women in United States were held in local jails in 2014, almost 14 times higher than in 1970s; rise in incarceration rates for women has occurred even as crime rates have declined nationally.
